Because the two sides that meet at \(X\) are equal ( \(XY = XZ\) ), the angles that are opposite those sides have to be equal.  
The side \(XY\) is opposite the angle at \(Z\) and the side \(XZ\) is opposite the angle at \(Y\).  
So the base‑angles \(\angle Y\) and \(\angle Z\) are the ones that must be equal.

\]
